Description: Lower body and conical foot sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style patterned, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black (fired red) with reserved dot in centre of bowl; exterior: reserved on bowl; glazed streaky black (fired red and worn) on foot; underside: trace of slip; inscription on underside.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding squat patterned chalices, see Lemos no. 1062 from Kamiros. the number 438 is written in pencil on the underside of the foot.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIV, no. 438)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 673, no. 317)
Johnston 2006a / Trademarks on Greek Vases: Addenda (p. 170, no. 40)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1099) (phase 2)
